extendedMetadata.value: LO: 10.2: What political conflicts did Jackson face and how did he resolve them?,

subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Analyze 10 01

config.question: Which of the following best completes these analogies:Andrew Jackson: __________; John Calhoun: __________?

choices.content: support for economic isolation, support for protectionism
support for nullification, support for the tariff
supremacy of the federal government, states’ rights

answer_3.response: Consider This: Jackson had asserted that the Union was indivisible. Although generally a defender of states’ rights and strict construction of the Constitution, Jackson opposed nullification as a threat to the Union. In his view, federal power should be held in check, but the states were not truly sovereign. See L.O. 10.2 What political conflicts did Jackson face and how did he resolve them?
